definition: contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system

sentences.english: However, even resist to all tin not do it, again He Tan resists.
sentences.chinese: 然而，連抗拒都做不到，又何談反抗。

sentences.english: At the same time, Shafei has the devil character to save herself .
sentences.chinese: 同時，莎菲又有自救反抗的魔性。

sentences.english: The climateof opinion is the very basis of the revolt.
sentences.chinese: 觀點的大環境是現在這場反抗的基礎。

sentences.english: Passengers had rebelled against the hijackers, who had turned the plane toward Washington.
sentences.chinese: 劫機者將飛機掉頭飛往華盛頓，乘客們奮起反抗。

sentences.english: The Mon Calamari are said to be the soul of the Rebel Alliance.
sentences.chinese: 蒙克萊梅利人常被稱爲是反抗軍聯盟的靈魂人物。

sentences.english: The entire nation raised up and drove the enemy soldiers out from their homeland.
sentences.chinese: 整個民族奮起反抗，把敵兵從國土上趕了出去。

sentences.english: Have certain effect to counteractive exhaustion and negative sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 對反抗疲憊與消極情緒有一定的作用。

sentences.english: Roderigo defied the old gentleman and refused to stir.
sentences.chinese: 羅特克還敢公然反抗那個老紳士，拒絕從命。

sentences.english: 《Robber 》reflected the youth revolting the feudalism system.
sentences.chinese: 《強盜》反映了青年人對封建專制制度的反抗。

sentences.english: The intruders' tyrannical behavior led the local people to revolt.
sentences.chinese: 略者的殘虐的行徑，激起了當地民衆的反抗。

sentences.english: There was no longer any possibility of suggesting limitations or of countenancing rebellion.
sentences.chinese: 已不允許再有任何對君權的限制或反抗。

sentences.english: Opposing tyranny, he led a poor life, and was very miserable in his late years.
sentences.chinese: 由於反抗暴政，他過得很窮苦，晚境淒涼。

sentences.english: Nale:I want my brother to suffer for daring to oppose me.
sentences.chinese: 我要我的兄弟因爲敢於反抗我而受到折磨。

sentences.english: China, like India, is a land of a million mutinies now.
sentences.chinese: 中國，就像印度，是一個有着上百萬反抗者的國家。

sentences.english: When his youngest son, whom he loved most defied him, his face turned purple with anger.
sentences.chinese: 當他最寵愛的小兒子公然反抗他時，他氣得臉色發青。

definition: to surrender/to succumb/to yield/(as a transitive verb) to defeat/to prevail over
to resist/to make a stand and fight (against)
to ravage/to devastate/to trample on/to violate
